decks.notes: This Grixis Aggro Legacy deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and True-Name Nemesis, along with powerful disruption tools like Force of Will and Cabal Therapy, the deck is able to apply early pressure while also disrupting the opponent's game plan. The mana base is streamlined with fetch lands to ensure consistent access to the deck's diverse color requirements. Overall, the deck seeks to win quickly through aggression and disruption.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive threats like Delver of Secrets, Monastery Swiftspear, and Stormchaser Mage while disrupting the opponent with countermagic like Force of Will and Daze. Price of Progress and Lightning Bolt provide additional reach and removal to close out games quickly. The deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent and force them to react to your threats while also keeping their own game plan in check with disruption spells like Flusterstorm and Izzet Charm. The mana base is built around fetching for the necessary colors to support the aggressive game plan.

The focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard by discarding cards and using various lands that deal damage to yourself. By utilizing the Dredge mechanic on cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp, the deck can quickly bring back creatures like Narcomoeba and Ichorid from the graveyard. This allows for explosive combos with Bridge from Below, generating a large number of Zombie tokens and overwhelming the opponent. The deck also includes disruption elements like Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly overwhelm your opponent with aggressive creatures like Nimble Mongoose and Delver of Secrets, while disrupting their game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. Cards like Stifle and Wasteland help to keep your opponent off balance while you maintain pressure. The deck also includes card draw and filtering with Ponder and Brainstorm to help find the cards you need to win the game. Fire / Ice provides additional removal or card draw. Overall, the deck aims to be fast, disruptive, and flexible in its strategy.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while controlling the board with efficient removal and card advantage. Utilizing powerful cards like Force of Will and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind out a win through attrition. The deck also includes cards like Leovold, Emissary of Trest and Deathrite Shaman to disrupt the opponent's mana base and graveyard, further limiting their options. The main goal is to disrupt the opponent's strategy, control the game, and win through incremental advantages.

The main concept of this Legacy deck is to combine aggressive creatures with disruptive spells in order to control the game and quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. Utilizing cards like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and Tombstalker for early pressure, backed up by cards like Hymn to Tourach, Fatal Push, and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck focuses on establishing early board presence and maintaining control of the game through a combination of aggression and disruption, with a flexible mana base to support its strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing elves to generate mana and quickly assemble a combo with cards like Heritage Druid, Glimpse of Nature, and Green Sun's Zenith. The goal is to accelerate into powerful threats like Craterhoof Behemoth and Nissa, Vital Force using cards like Natural Order to cheat them into play. With the ability to quickly produce mana, the deck can overwhelm opponents with a large number of creatures and finish the game in a decisive manner.

The main idea of this Grixis Control deck is to use a combination of card advantage, disruption, and powerful threats to control the game and out-value the opponent. By using cards like Gitaxian Probe, Preordain, Cabal Therapy, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage for the player. With efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Abrade, along with counter spells like Force of Will, the deck can answer threats effectively. Finally, powerful threats like Gurmag Angler, Young Pyromancer, and Baleful Strix provide a clock to close out the game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful planeswalkers. It utilizes cards like Snapcaster Mage, Force of Will, and Brainstorm to maintain card advantage and disruption. The inclusion of cards like Leovold, Emissary of Trest and Punishing Fire adds additional value and versatility to the deck. Overall, this control deck aims to outlast and outplay opponents through efficient card selection and powerful threats, making it a formidable force in the Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand and board presence through discard spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, while also using efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and Tombstalker to pressure the opponent quickly. The deck also utilizes powerful blue spells like Brainstorm and Force of Will to control the game and protect its threats. Additionally, the inclusion of versatile removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay help deal with opposing threats. The deck aims to win the game through a combination of aggression and disruption.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker to slow down the opponent's spells and abilities, while using cards like Stoneforge Mystic to put powerful equipment into play, the deck aims to control the board and win through combat damage. The inclusion of cards like Karakas and Flickerwisp also allows for tricky interactions and tempo swings, giving the deck flexibility in dealing with a variety of threats.

The deck focuses on using land cards to control the game, denying resources and disrupting the opponent's plans. It utilizes cards like Wasteland, Rishadan Port, and Ghost Quarter to destroy the opponent's lands, while also using cards like Thespian's Stage and Dark Depths to create a powerful 20/20 token. Life from the Loam allows for consistent land recursion, while Punishing Fire provides removal and a win condition. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by effectively managing its resources and controlling the board.

This Merfolk deck focuses on quickly deploying threats and disrupting the opponent with countermagic and land destruction. By utilizing cards like Aether Vial and Chalice of the Void, it aims to leverage its tribal synergies and protect its key creatures like True-Name Nemesis. With a low mana curve and aggressive creatures like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident, the deck can apply pressure early and maintain tempo throughout the game. The inclusion of cards like Mutavault and Wasteland also allows for additional disruption and flexibility in dealing with opposing strategies.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to control the game through a combination of card advantage, board wipes like Terminus, and countermagic like Force of Will. It aims to manipulate the top of the deck with cards like Brainstorm and Predict, while using cards such as Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Search for Azcanta to generate card advantage. The deck also includes versatile removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and counterspells like Counterbalance to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Engineered Explosives provides additional flexibility for handling threats on the board.

This UWx Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful control spells such as Force of Will and Counterbalance to manage the opponent's threats. By including a mix of card draw, removal spells like Swords to Plowshares, and board wipes like Terminus, the deck aims to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent. The inclusion of powerful win conditions like Entreat the Angels and Jace, the Mind Sculptor provide a way to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been exhausted. The deck's strategy revolves around carefully managing resources and controlling the pace of the game.

This deck focuses on using efficient creatures and disruptive spells to control the game while applying steady pressure on the opponent. It combines powerful threats like True-Name Nemesis and Leovold, Emissary of Trest with versatile cards like Baleful Strix and Deathrite Shaman to create a strong board presence. The deck also includes powerful control elements like Force of Will and Hymn to Tourach to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to maintain board control while swiftly closing out the game with its aggressive creatures.
